title: About
text:
To conduct this analysis, I utilised a data set comprising all seven Harry Potter books in TXT format, which had been preprocessed by Mateusz Kudla and made available on Kaggle.
Additional preprocessing was performed using the tidytext and textdata packages in R. Each book‚Äôs text was segmented into chapters, allowing for a more granular analysis. The chapter-wise text was then compiled into a tibble, facilitating streamlined data handling and analysis.

title: Jenevieve‚Äôs Website üß∏üçì
text:
Hello and welcome to my webpage! My name is Jenevieve and this is my first time attempting to create a data story.
I am a Year 1 Communications and New Media major with a minor in Interactive Media Development. This webpage serves as a platform for me to share my journey, insights and project with you.
Thank you for visiting!üíü

What emotions are evoked in the Harry Potter series, and how do they evolve over time?
for NM2207.

  
  Our first look at Harry.

This all started with a particularly interesting question. 
Picture this: It‚Äôs a rainy afternoon and you‚Äôre diving back into the magical world of Harry Potter, when suddenly, a curious question strikes you like a bolt of lightning‚ö° - what if we could quantify the emotional impact of each chapter, dissecting the highs and lows with the precision of a potion master?
As I embarked on my journey through the pages of J.K. Rowling‚Äôs beloved series once more, this question lingered in the back of my mind like a persistent spell. Could the joy, the sorrow, the excitement, and the fear evoked by these timeless tales be quantified and analysed?
To do this, I retrieved a proprocessed dataset which contained all Harry Potter books in txt file format, and ran them through an emotion sentiment analyser , a powerful tool promising to unveil the hidden emotional nuances nestled within the text. 

The difference between how readers interpret a passage's emotion sentiment and how an emotion sentiment analyser interprets the passage lies in the subjective nature of human emotions and the objective algorithms used by sentiment analysis tools.

Readers‚Äô Interpretation: Readers‚Äô interpretation of emotion sentiment is subjective and influenced by individual experiences, perspectives, and cultural backgrounds. They may perceive emotions differently based on personal context, preferences, and emotional sensitivity.
Emotion Sentiment Analyzer‚Äôs Interpretation: Emotion sentiment analysis relies on objective algorithms to analyse text and quantify emotional content. These algorithms are trained on large datasets and use predefined rules or machine learning models to identify and categorise emotional cues in text.

Before we get into the results of the data analysis, let‚Äôs play a game to see how you would identify and categorise emotional cues in text.
Here are several excerpts from the actual Harry Potter books. For each one, select which emotion you think is the most prevalent. Don‚Äôt think too hard about it‚Äîjust react!
due to problems encountered with the game, it has not been included in the website yet.
As you read the Harry Potter excerpts, you likely gravitated towards specific emotions, reflecting your individual perspective and emotional awareness. This subjective interpretation is a hallmark of human cognition, shaped by our individual experiences, biases, and cultural backgrounds.
In contrast, emotion sentiment analysers rely on objective algorithms to analyze text and measure emotional content. While these algorithms provide insights and efficiency in processing large volumes of data, they lack the nuanced understanding and context of human emotion interpretation.
Now, let‚Äôs see how the emotion sentiment analyser interprets the Harry Potter series using the data gathered.


  
  Platform nine and three-quarters.

  
 ‚ö°Ô∏è‚öØ üßπ 

Sentimentr Package 
The sentimentr package by Tyler Rinker in R is designed to accurately calculate text polarity sentiment at both the sentence and token levels. It offers enhanced precision in sentiment scoring by considering valence shifters like negators, amplifiers, de-amplifiers, and adversative conjunctions.
  
 üè∞üîÆ‚ú® 
Two Sentiments: Positive and Negative 



    



By plotting at the sentiment score for each chapter of each book, we can clearly mark events in the books. 
The three greatest spikes in that chart above are 
Cedric Diggory‚Äôs death at about chapter 88, 
Sirius Black's death at about chapter 129, and 
Dumbledore‚Äôs death at about chapter 159.
  
 ü¶Åüêçü¶Öü¶°
Eight Basic Emotions: Anger, Disgust, Fear, Joy, Sadness, Surprise, Trust, and Anticipation

title: Dataset
text:
Running Code
When you click the Render button a document will be generated that includes both content and the output of embedded code. You can embed code like this:

1 + 1

[1] 2


You can add options to executable code like this


[1] 4


The echo: false option disables the printing of code (only output is displayed).

title: About

To conduct this analysis, I utilised a data set comprising all seven Harry Potter books in TXT format, which had been preprocessed by Mateusz Kudla and made available on Kaggle.
Additional preprocessing was performed using the tidytext and textdata packages in R. Each book‚Äôs text was segmented into chapters, allowing for a more granular analysis. The chapter-wise text was then compiled into a tibble, facilitating streamlined data handling and analysis.
